metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18029 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.6-10 Q16, a memory leak vulnerability was found in the function ReadMATImage in coders/mat.c, which allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18029` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> not fixing memory leak in trusty and xenial

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
